projectPurpose: To provide a fast, flexible, and easy-to-use command-line interface and Python library for developers and researchers to extract raw or structured blockchain data from various EVM-compatible networks and output it into common data formats for analysis and storage.
mainFeatures: Extracts blockchain data (blocks, transactions, logs, traces, storage diffs)
Outputs data to parquet, csv, json, or python dataframes
Flexible filtering by block ranges, contracts, columns, and events
High-performance data extraction powered by Rust
Supports multiple EVM-compatible blockchain networks

alternatives.name: The Graph
mainFeatures: Decentralized protocol for indexing blockchain data
Query data using GraphQL APIs (Subgraphs)
Supports a wide range of blockchain networks
Offers real-time data streams (Substreams)
Provides a hosted service and decentralized network

alternatives.name: Dune Analytics
mainFeatures: Platform for querying blockchain data using SQL
Community-driven dashboards and visualizations
Supports multiple blockchain networks
Provides real-time data updates
Focuses on analytics for DeFi, NFTs, etc.

alternatives.name: Nansen
mainFeatures: Blockchain analytics platform with wallet labeling ('Smart Money')
Dashboards for tracking on-chain activity and trends
Real-time data and alerts
Supports multiple blockchains
In-depth analytics on tokens, NFTs, and wallets

alternatives.name: SubQuery Network
mainFeatures: Decentralized data indexing framework
Provides custom APIs for web3 projects
Open-source indexer SDK
Supports cross-chain data aggregation
Decentralized network of indexers and RPC providers

alternatives.name: TrueBlocks
mainFeatures: Local indexing of Ethereum blockchain data
Query transaction history and wallet balances
Can work offline
Supports EVM-based chains
Human-readable output using contract ABIs ('articulation')

alternatives.name: Subsquid
mainFeatures: Data network for efficient blockchain data retrieval
Open-source SDK for data extraction and transformation
ETL capabilities
GraphQL server for querying indexed data
Supports a large number of chains (EVM and Substrate)

marketPositioning: cryo positions itself as a high-performance, flexible data extraction tool for blockchain data, focusing on providing raw or structured data in common formats (parquet, csv, json, dataframes) for developers and researchers. Unlike end-to-end analytics platforms or indexing protocols that offer querying APIs, cryo specializes in the initial data fetching phase. Its command-line and Python interfaces, combined with Rust's performance, make it suitable for programmatic access and large-scale data processing, filling a niche for users who need to integrate blockchain data into their existing data pipelines and analysis workflows.
expandedDescription: cryo is a powerful and flexible open-source command-line interface and Python library built in Rust, designed to streamline the extraction of blockchain data from various EVM-compatible networks. It provides developers, data scientists, and researchers with an efficient way to fetch raw or structured blockchain information, including blocks, transactions, logs, and traces. Unlike platforms focused on analysis or indexed querying, cryo specializes in the crucial data extraction step, outputting data directly into widely compatible formats such as Parquet, CSV, JSON, and native Python dataframes (Pandas, Polars). This allows seamless integration with existing data analysis pipelines and tools. With extensive options for filtering by block ranges, contract addresses, specific columns, or event signatures, and the ability to manage request rates for third-party RPC providers, cryo offers granular control and high performance for accessing and processing large volumes of on-chain data.
